instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 Charging Issues
threads.message:
So tonight I have an 820-2936 on the bench from a customer who states they are having charging issues. They claim sometimes the battery will charge and sometimes it will not. So I took off the bottom and check the current sense resistors and they measure the correct values vs the schematic. I did take note that is it a knock off battery (Ansanour). Funny thing happens, when I try to turn the power off without an Apple OG Magsafe the computer will not turn on. When I plug Magsafe in it boots up. The battery indicator is saying 100% but as soon as I unplug the MS the computer shuts off. I put an older original Apple battery in and the computer will start on battery and MS. If I unplug the MS the computer stays running. The current battery level is steadily going down from 97% to 92%. My question is, is this simply a case of a bad battery? they said they have replaced it a couple times.

Board looks super clean also.

threads.title: 820-2936 Charging Issues
threads.message:
Probably crappy chinese battery.
Disconnect BIL and see if better...

threads.title: 820-2936 Charging Issues
threads.message: No change after unplugging BIL. Knock off battery has 44 Charge cycles and has the "Replace Now" battery status. Max Capacity is 5288mAh.

threads.title: 820-2936 Charging Issues
threads.message: Get known good battery and stop to throw money on chinese bulshits...

threads.title: 820-2936 Charging Issues
threads.message: That is exactly what I will tell the customer. Stop putting crap batteries in people?s computers.
